alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 3:26PM EST until December 19 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Ammonoosuc River At Bethlehem affecting Grafton County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Ammonoosuc River at Bethlehem. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding occurs along portions Route 116/Whitefield Road. Portions of Feather Lane, Wing Road, Hazen Road, and Prospect Street are flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 12.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM EST Monday was 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 12.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 3.2 feet early Wednesday morning. It will rise to 3.7 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
